title: Storm-Chaser Mobile Lab Adventure #44
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Main Laboratory
rooms.description: The interior of a high-tech mobile weather lab rocks violently as hurricane-force winds batter the vehicle. Computer screens flicker with storm data. Rain hammers against reinforced windows. Emergency lights cast an eerie red glow. You need to reach the underground shelter before the storm destroys the lab.

items.name: weather monitoring station
items.description: A bank of computers displaying real-time storm data and warnings
items.text: SEVERE WEATHER ALERT: Category 5 storm approaching. Wind speed: 175 mph. Barometric pressure: 892 mb. All personnel evacuate to emergency shelter immediately. Lead researcher: Dr Sarah Chen.

items.name: research desk
items.description: A cluttered desk covered with papers, instruments, and locked drawers

items.name: team roster document
items.description: A list of the storm-chasing team members
items.text: Storm-Chaser Team #44: Lead Researcher - Dr Sarah Chen, Meteorologist - James Torres, Equipment Specialist - Maria Rodriguez, Data Analyst - Kevin Park. Emergency shelter code based on current wind speed reading.

items.name: security access card
items.description: A magnetic keycard labeled 'Equipment Bay Access'

items.name: locked wall cabinet
items.description: A metal cabinet with a keycard reader and emergency supplies visible through the glass

items.name: emergency procedures manual
items.description: A red binder containing safety protocols
items.text: EMERGENCY SHELTER ACCESS: Located in Equipment Bay. Shelter hatch requires master key from equipment locker. Shelter entrance combination: Current barometric pressure reading (no decimal point).

items.name: heavy-duty flashlight
items.description: A waterproof flashlight for emergency use

items.name: framed photograph
items.description: A photo on the desk showing the research team

items.name: handwritten note
items.description: A note tucked behind the photo
items.text: Remember: Equipment locker code is the year we started this project - 2018. Stay safe out there! - Dr Sarah Chen

items.name: reinforced rear door
items.description: A heavy door leading to the equipment bay at the back of the mobile lab

rooms.name: Equipment Bay
rooms.description: The rear section of the mobile lab filled with weather instruments, storage lockers, and emergency gear. The vehicle lurches as the storm intensifies. A circular hatch in the floor leads to the underground emergency shelter. Warning lights flash urgently.

items.name: large equipment locker
items.description: A tall metal locker with a combination lock and various compartments

items.name: shelter master key
items.description: A heavy brass key labeled 'Emergency Shelter Access'

items.name: storm tracking log
items.description: A detailed log of storm measurements and observations
items.text: Storm Log Entry #44: This is the most intense storm we've tracked. Dr Sarah Chen recorded pressure at 892 mb - lowest ever measured. Wind speeds reached 175 mph. Team members Torres, Rodriguez, and Park have already evacuated to shelter.

items.name: deflated weather balloon
items.description: A collapsed weather balloon used for atmospheric measurements

items.name: instrument rack
items.description: A rack holding various weather monitoring devices

items.name: portable barometer
items.description: A precision instrument showing current atmospheric pressure
items.text: Current Reading: 892 mb (millibars). CRITICAL LOW PRESSURE - EXTREME DANGER

items.name: emergency supply crate
items.description: A crate containing survival supplies and equipment

items.name: first aid kit
items.description: A red medical kit with basic supplies

items.name: emergency shelter hatch
items.description: A reinforced circular hatch in the floor with a complex locking mechanism. Three security questions are displayed on a digital panel.

password_questions.question: Who is the lead researcher?
password_questions.hint: Check the weather monitoring station and team roster

password_questions.question: What is the equipment specialist's last name?
password_questions.hint: Look at the team roster document

password_questions.question: What is the shelter entrance combination?
password_questions.hint: The emergency manual says to use the barometric pressure reading

rooms.name: Underground Emergency Shelter
rooms.description: You've made it to safety! A reinforced concrete bunker deep underground, completely isolated from the raging storm above. The shelter is stocked with food, water, and supplies. Comfortable bunks line the walls. A radio crackles with weather updates. Through the thick walls, you can barely hear the muffled roar of the storm, but you are completely safe.

items.name: supply shelves
items.description: Shelves stocked with emergency food, water, and survival gear

items.name: emergency radio
items.description: A radio receiving weather service broadcasts
items.text: WEATHER SERVICE: Storm-Chaser Mobile Lab #44 reported destroyed by Category 5 storm. All personnel confirmed safe in emergency shelter. Rescue teams will arrive when conditions permit. Estimated 24-48 hours.

items.name: shelter bunk beds
items.description: Comfortable beds where you can rest safely until rescue arrives

rooms.win_message: SUCCESS! You've reached the emergency shelter just in time. The storm rages above, but you are safe underground with plenty of supplies. Your quick thinking and puzzle-solving skills saved your life. The mobile lab may be destroyed, but you survived Storm-Chaser Adventure #44. Rescue teams are on their way. You win!
